question: According to the lecturer in Sc1007_videolecture, is the lab graded, and how is attendance handled?
ground_truth: The lab itself is not graded, but attendance is still taken. Skipping labs may hurt performance in lab tests. (Reference: Sc1007_videolecture)

answer: According to the lecturer in the Sc1007_videolecture, the lab is not graded. However, attendance is still taken, and while it is not guaranteed that students will do well in the lab test if they choose not to attend, the lecturer strongly recommends attending the lab sessions, especially in the second half of the tutorial. Attendance for the tests is compulsory, and failing to attend will result in receiving zero marks for that portion of the assessment. This information is covered at [08:17.24], [08:34.88], and [08:06.36].

question: When is the combined lab test and quiz scheduled, and what does the quiz cover mentioned in Sc1007_videolecture?
ground_truth: Week 14 (April 20): a combined two-hour lab test and quiz. The MCQ tests concepts from Weeks 1-13, including analysis of algorithms. (Reference: Sc1007_videolecture)

[Video title] Sc1007_videolecture

[Transcript] (06:01.96) The MCQ part will test you on concepts from Week 1 to Week 13, covering everything, especially this week's topic, analysis of algorithms.
(06:17.84) As I mentioned, I won't be able to set any programming questions for that kind of problem, but it will definitely appear in the quiz.
(06:25.80) The concepts from all topics, including linked lists, binary trees, hash tables, graphs, dynamic programming, and matching problems, will be tested in the quiz.
(06:40.36) For lab test 2, there will be three programming questions.
(06:48.68) It will be a two-hour test.
(06:48.88) The format of the programming part will be similar to the upcoming lab test 1.

answer: The combined lab test and quiz for the course are scheduled for April 20, 2023. The quiz will cover concepts from Week 1 to Week 13, including topics such as linked lists, binary trees, hash tables, graphs, dynamic programming, and matching problems, with a particular emphasis on the analysis of algorithms from the current week. This information is detailed in the video at "Covered at 06:01" and "Covered at 06:25".
